meanings.definition: A person who talks excessively or idly.
meanings.sent1: The gabbers in the class never stopped talking.
meanings.sent2: She is known as the gabbers of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The gabbers at the party kept everyone entertained with their stories.
meanings.sent4: Her father was a true gabbers, always sharing his thoughts with anyone who would listen.
meanings.sent5: The little girl was a gabbers, chatting away about her day at school.

meanings.sent1: He gabbers on the phone for hours.
meanings.sent2: The radio host gabbers about the latest news every morning.
meanings.sent3: The parrot learned to gabbers from listening to its owner.
meanings.sent4: The engine of the old car gabbers noisily as it struggles up the hill.
meanings.sent5: The rain gabbers on the roof, creating a soothing sound for sleep.
